title: PSA: Underplayed ≠ Underpowered
body:
"I've never seen Anivia, this must mean she's horrible, Riot should buff her!"

"I've never even seen Soraka, but someone told me she's bad, Riot should buff her!"

Stop

Stop

Stop

its not they are underpowered, in fact they often have better ratios. 
they are picked less because ....

**THEY DONT ACCOMPLISH A GIVEN TASK LIKE OTHER META CHAMPIONS DO**

Vi and jarvan for the longest time were played because they were experts at coming from behind, gap closing, and successfully ganking a lane. 
zed, leblanc, riven, are lane bullies, they get solo kills and get ahead.
jinx rockets all 5 targets for full damage and secures kills with her rocket. sivir makes sure they can hard engage and force a fight whenever they want to.


twitch on the other hand has 2 steroids which give him great pick potential and can hit the enemy back line in a lot of different ways and possibly kill them.
anivia throws slows out and has the slowest af Q ever which is easily dodged, making her dependent on others to hard cc first and she can follow up with her great damage.
trundle top lane is a lane bully and is great at tank busting, split pushing and 1v1ing someone thanks to raw stats. however he is easily kited by everyone with a closer/escape or knocked out of the fight entirely making him non existent thanks a lee sin kick or alistar. 
rammus jungle just gets invaded early and killed, the enemy will flash your powerball and then just duel you thanks to your low mana and low early damage output. 


its not that they cant be played, but you need a true team to make any of these champions work. 
other champions like

ahri, azir, janna, hecarim, nidalee, kalista have no clear weaknesses and have great kits which work well together, these champions can be safely picked into nearly any team comp and your team is better for having picked some of these champions. 

a champion like lux, will just get dived on by a champion like zed, rengar, khazix, leblanc and she would just die. so she has to stay super far back to compensate.

I would buy that, except for one thing. You wanna know how a champ becomes meta? Someone starts playing a champ, other people see them do well, and they copy it. Nautilus is starting to be picked in top lane now in both NA and EU LCS. Why? Because a fucking Korean team did it. That shit would've been troll a month ago. What has changed for top lane Naut since then? Nothing. He hasn't changed, his items haven't changed, and the top lane meta hasn't really changed. A Korean team could play Lux, dominate with it, people start playing Lux, and we start complaining about how OP Lux is a month from now.

Naut can go anywhere xD But it kind of reminds me how troll ad fizz top used to be :P This is how stupid the system is. Too many people are literally sheep to the meta.

Ahri, Azir, Janna, Hecarim, Nidalee, and Kalista all have clear weaknesses they just have a lot of saftey and utility.   Ahri lacks the damage most Mages have and only has one CC that is a skill shot.  Janna lacks defenses and damage.  Hecarim is melee.  Nidalee needs to land an easily dodge-able(when not used in the fog of war) skill shot,  Kalista has a bad time in the early game, teammate needs to know how to effectively use her ult, and she needs her soul linked teamate in order to get her damage.  Azir needs his sand soldiers to do anything and he has a high skill floor compared to most champions.  I agree with everything else.

Hecarim's lack of projectiles really isn't as much of a weakness as for most other melee champs.  His real weakness is that his damage output is tied to movement speed, which means all you have to do is exhaust him (or better yet, have Nasus or Zilean slow him) then kite the hell out of him.
